comments:
I removed plugin com.atlassw.tools.eclipse.checkstyle_3.2.0.1. I thought it was
causing an error 'Problems occurred with invoking code from plug-in:
"org.eclipse.core.runtime". I removed the plug-in from my plugin directory. 

When I restarted Eclipse context menus no longer worked on the Package Explorer,
Hierarchy, Outline, Junit, Debug, any of CVS views. They still work on the Ant
view, the editor, the Error Log. The preference dialog displays with nothing
showing in the list box or on the dialog. Right click on the an Error Log item
and selecting the properties menu choice also fails. Eclipse is pretty much
hosed. I have restarted Eclipse twice. I plan to next restart the PC to see, if
this affect it.

I will attach my .log file in moment
Created an attachment (id=7347)
Current Log file
Rebooting had no affect on the problem. I zipped up my metadata directory and
restarted Eclipse. The problem still occurred. Eclipse also was confused during
the process of importing projects. 

I also had a different project directory setup for this version of Eclipse. This
work area doesn't have any of the projects found in my main work area. I thought
the problem might be was caused by a corrupted .project file or other project
related file, but this work area was also corrupted.

Created an attachment (id=7348)
Main work area second try

Clean or alternative workspace log file
I've kept the old Eclipse directory, if you need some other files to help track
down this problem.
This seems to be caused by NPE in 

java.lang.NullPointerException
  at org.eclipse.ui.internal.registry.RegistryReader$1.compare
(RegistryReader.java:103)

Moving to Platform/UI
What milestone/version are you using?  This might be a dupe of Bug 48839.  If
you're using M5 or later, try deleting your eclipse/.config directory and then
restart.
